name: inarticulacy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the state of being unable to express feelings or ideas clearly, or of being expressed in a way that is difficult to understand: His inarticulacy is taken for stupidity. Some people believe this inarticulacy is intentional. See
inarticulate
More examplesFewer examplesInarticulacy leads to an inability to communicate.Inarticulacy seemed to become a political asset.You would think that his inarticulacy and lack of social graces would exile him from polite society.I was appalled by the inarticulacy of the message.
